[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@firebase/util](./util.md)

## util package

Utility functions for Firebase packages.

 This is specifically tailored for Firebase JS SDK usage, if you are not a member of the Firebase team, please avoid using this package

|  [createSubscribe(executor, onNoObservers)](./util.createsubscribe.md) | Helper to make a Subscribe function (just like Promise helps make a Thenable). |
|  [deepCopy(value)](./util.deepcopy.md) | Do a deep-copy of basic JavaScript Objects or Arrays. |
|  [deepExtend(target, source)](./util.deepextend.md) | Copy properties from source to target (recursively allows extension of Objects and Arrays). Scalar values in the target are over-written. If target is undefined, an object of the appropriate type will be created (and returned).<!-- -->We recursively copy all child properties of plain Objects in the source- so that namespace- like dictionaries are merged.<!-- -->Note that the target can be a function, in which case the properties in the source Object are copied onto it as static properties of the Function. |
|  [errorPrefix(fnName, argumentNumber, optional)](./util.errorprefix.md) | Generates a string to prefix an error message about failed argument validation |
|  [getUA()](./util.getua.md) | Returns navigator.userAgent string or '' if it's not defined.  user agent string |
|  [isBrowser()](./util.isbrowser.md) | Detect Browser Environment |
|  [isBrowserExtension()](./util.isbrowserextension.md) |  |
|  [isElectron()](./util.iselectron.md) | Detects Electron apps. |
|  [isEmpty(obj)](./util.isempty.md) |  |
|  [isIE()](./util.isie.md) | Detects Internet Explorer. |
|  [isMobileCordova()](./util.ismobilecordova.md) | Detect Cordova / PhoneGap / Ionic frameworks on a mobile device.<!-- -->Deliberately does not rely on checking <code>file://</code> URLs (as this fails PhoneGap in the Ripple emulator) nor Cordova <code>onDeviceReady</code>, which would normally wait for a callback. |
|  [isNode()](./util.isnode.md) | Detect Node.js. true if Node.js environment is detected. |
|  [isNodeSdk()](./util.isnodesdk.md) | Detect whether the current SDK build is the Node version. true if it's the Node SDK build. |
|  [isReactNative()](./util.isreactnative.md) | Detect React Native. true if ReactNative environment is detected. |
|  [isUWP()](./util.isuwp.md) | Detects Universal Windows Platform apps. |
|  [jsonEval(str)](./util.jsoneval.md) | Evaluates a JSON string into a javascript object. |
|  [map(obj, fn, contextObj)](./util.map.md) |  |
|  [querystring(querystringParams)](./util.querystring.md) | Returns a querystring-formatted string (e.g. &amp;arg=val&amp;arg2=val2) from a params object (e.g. {<!-- -->arg: 'val', arg2: 'val2'<!-- -->}<!-- -->) Note: You must prepend it with ? when adding it to a URL. |
|  [querystringDecode(querystring)](./util.querystringdecode.md) | Decodes a querystring (e.g. ?arg=val&amp;arg2=val2) into a params object (e.g. {<!-- -->arg: 'val', arg2: 'val2'<!-- -->}<!-- -->) |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [assert](./util.assert.md) | Throws an error if the provided assertion is falsy |
|  [assertionError](./util.assertionerror.md) | Returns an Error object suitable for throwing. |
|  [base64](./util.base64.md) |  |
|  [base64Decode](./util.base64decode.md) | URL-safe base64 decoding<!-- -->NOTE: DO NOT use the global atob() function - it does NOT support the base64Url variant encoding. |
|  [base64Encode](./util.base64encode.md) | URL-safe base64 encoding |
|  [CONSTANTS](./util.constants.md) |  Firebase constants. Some of these (<!-- -->@<!-- -->defines) can be overridden at compile-time. |
|  [decode](./util.decode.md) | Decodes a Firebase auth. token into constituent parts.<!-- -->Notes: - May return with invalid / incomplete claims if there's no native base64 decoding support. - Doesn't check if the token is actually valid. |
|  [isAdmin](./util.isadmin.md) | Attempts to peer into an auth token and determine if it's an admin auth token by looking at the claims portion.<!-- -->Notes: - May return a false negative if there's no native base64 decoding support. - Doesn't check if the token is actually valid. |
|  [issuedAtTime](./util.issuedattime.md) | Decodes a Firebase auth. token and returns its issued at time if valid, null otherwise.<!-- -->Notes: - May return null if there's no native base64 decoding support. - Doesn't check if the token is actually valid. |
|  [isValidFormat](./util.isvalidformat.md) | Decodes a Firebase auth. token and checks the validity of its format. Expects a valid issued-at time.<!-- -->Notes: - May return a false negative if there's no native base64 decoding support. - Doesn't check if the token is actually valid. |
|  [isValidTimestamp](./util.isvalidtimestamp.md) | Decodes a Firebase auth. token and checks the validity of its time-based claims. Will return true if the token is within the time window authorized by the 'nbf' (not-before) and 'iat' (issued-at) claims.<!-- -->Notes: - May return a false negative if there's no native base64 decoding support. - Doesn't check if the token is actually valid. |
|  [stringLength](./util.stringlength.md) | Calculate length without actually converting; useful for doing cheaper validation. |
|  [stringToByteArray](./util.stringtobytearray.md) |  |
|  [validateArgCount](./util.validateargcount.md) | Check to make sure the appropriate number of arguments are provided for a public function. Throws an error if it fails. |

|  [ErrorMap](./util.errormap.md) |  Standardized Firebase Error.<!-- -->Usage:<!-- -->// Typescript string literals for type-safe codes type Err = 'unknown' \| 'object-not-found' ;<!-- -->// Closure enum for type-safe error codes // at-enum {<!-- -->string<!-- -->} var Err = { UNKNOWN: 'unknown', OBJECT\_NOT\_FOUND: 'object-not-found', }<!-- -->let errors: Map<!-- -->&lt;<!-- -->Err, string<!-- -->&gt; = { 'generic-error': "Unknown error", 'file-not-found': "Could not find file: {<!-- -->$file<!-- -->}<!-- -->", }<!-- -->;<!-- -->// Type-safe function - must pass a valid error code as param. let error = new ErrorFactory<Err>('service', 'Service', errors);<!-- -->... throw error.create(Err.GENERIC); ... throw error.create(Err.FILE\_NOT\_FOUND, {<!-- -->'file': fileName<!-- -->}<!-- -->); ... // Service: Could not file file: foo.txt (service/file-not-found).<!-- -->catch (e) { assert(e.message === "Could not find file: foo.txt."); if (e.code === 'service/file-not-found') { console.log("Could not read file: " + e\['file'\]); } } |
